result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence Lewis III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to:  to any other sentence.
Court will allow for release for work and childcare. Court remains silent in regards to electronic monitoring.
**4/4/2016 Honorable Carolina Maria Stark.  Order signed, credit amended to zero (0) days.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, assessments, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) 
-Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
No possession of firearms, ammunition, magazine, holster, or body armor.

No possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription for the defendant or his children, and used in the manner instructed by a doctor
No possession of drug paraphernalia.

Absolute sobriety.
Participate in drug an alcohol testing.
Complete alternative to revocation associated with case #06CF4456.
Provide a DNA sample.
Court will NOT suspend the defendant's drivers license.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence Lewis III

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Order signed on 4/4/2016: "Judgement of conviction shall be amended to state zero (0)  days of sentence credit".

Order Amending Judgment of Conviction, received and filed. tk
Copies mailed to parties.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. mag
DOC request to review order for sentence credit.

Defendant Lawrence Lewis in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 40 DAYS at the House of Corrections with 2 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence. Court will allow for release for work and childcare. Court remains silent in regards to electronic monitoring.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 12 MONTHS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
-Absolute sobriety
-No possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription for the defendant or his children, and used in the manner instructed by a doctor
-No possession of drug paraphernalia
-Participate in drug an alcohol testing
-Complete alternative to revocation associated with case #06CF4456
-Maintain full-time employment
-No possession of firearms, ammunition, magazine, holster, or body armor
-Provide a DNA sample


Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, assessments, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) 
-Cash bail on deposit to be applied.

Court will NOT suspend the defendant's drivers license


Filed:  
Letter in support of the defendant
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Alternative to revocation agreement  form from 06CF4456 submitted by the defense received and filed.

Defendant Lawrence Lewis in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court begins reviewing the Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form. Court allows a break to allow the Defendant time to talk to his attorney.
Case recalled. Same appearances. Case proceeds to plea hearing.
AS TO COUNT  1- 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Case is adjourned for Sentencing on 6-19-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lawrence Lewis in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Paul Hauer for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for Status of Counsel. Counsel for the Defense will now be Attorney Phillips. For the reasons placed on the record the case is adjourned for Projected Plea Hearing on 5-7-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17. 
Any motions are due no later than 5-7-2015 by 8:30 a.m.  Calendar call scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lawrence Lewis in court with attorney Curt Rogers.  Paul Hauer for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Plea Hearing. Defendant addresses the Court requesting new counsel. Defense counsel does not object. State does not object. Case adjourned for Status of Counsel on 4-9-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Status conference scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lawrence Lewis in court with attorney Curt Rogers.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense needs additional time to review offer and discovery.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea to Branch 17.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing FEBRUARY 10, 2015 received and filed. (24 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to CURT ROGERS 5840 N RIVER FOREST DR GLENDALE WI 53209.

15RM006136  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-05-2015

Defendant Lawrence Lewis in court with attorney Curt Rogers.  Ron Dague for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense motion to adjourn the Preliminary Hearing is denied at this time.  State has an officer present for today's proceedings. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #02CF2849 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:Joseph Baltutis-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Lawrence Lewis in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  
Defendant Lawrence Lewis in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
